intro: Hibbertia angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf hibbertia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Dilleniaceae and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers with red centers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in coastal and inland regions. Hibbertia angustifolia has narrow, linear leaves and is known for its ornamental value in gardens. It is also valued for its ecological role in supporting local pollinators.
